decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Basking Rootwalla, Bloodghast, and Vengevine. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stitcher's Supplier, the deck is able to consistently fuel its graveyard and cheat out big threats like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Hollow One. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Force of Vigor and Cabal Therapy helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a fast clock to overwhelm them. The deck aims to close out games quickly by utilizing the synergy between graveyard recursion and aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful artifact creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with taxing effects like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Karn, the Great Creator, while generating advantage with cards like Mystic Forge and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim. The mana base is focused on maximizing the use of Mishra's Workshop and other artifact lands, while also including utility lands like Karakas and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggro strategies and disruptive effects.

The deck focuses on a disruptive strategy using cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Collector Ouphe to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the board. The deck's mana base is designed to support the casting of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, while also having a strong land destruction package with Wasteland and Strip Mine. Force of Will and other counterspells help protect its key threats and disrupt the opponent's plays.

This deck focuses on using powerful mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Mana Crypt to quickly assemble a combo involving Paradoxical Outcome. The deck aims to draw as many cards as possible by casting spells like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Gitaxian Probe, while protecting itself with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. The combo is often supported by cards like Tinker, Bolas's Citadel, and Yawgmoth's Will to generate large amounts of mana and draw more cards. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game.

The deck focuses on disruptive and efficient creatures, paired with powerful blue spells to control the game. By playing cards like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf early on, it aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. With a suite of powerful draw spells and countermagic, the deck can maintain its advantage and close out the game quickly. The synergy between powerful creatures and disruptive spells allows for a flexible and adaptable game plan against a variety of opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and replay powerful artifacts while generating mana through artifacts like Mox Opal and Sol Ring. It also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful spells, ultimately leading to a win through a powerful board state or combo finish.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach for powerful combo plays. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and tutors to set up the combo pieces quickly. The key strategy is to fill the graveyard with spells and then use Underworld Breach to cast them repeatedly, generating card advantage and overwhelming the opponent. The deck also features disruptive cards like Pyroblast and Force of Will to protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in a fast and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through disruptive spells like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy, while simultaneously applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko and Narset to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe help to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from efficiently building their own board state. This deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to close out the game quickly. By utilizing disruptive creatures like Lavinia and Spirit of the Labyrinth, along with hate cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Chalice of the Void, the deck can slow down the opponent's strategy. Meanwhile, cards like Mirran Crusader and Luminarch Aspirant offer a fast clock to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck, enabling the aggressive gameplan while still being able to interact with the opponent's key cards.

This deck focuses on disruptive and versatile threats that disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong tempo advantage. By utilizing powerful midrange threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, alongside disruptive spells such as Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy, this deck aims to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of key card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise allows the deck to maintain card advantage while efficiently answering threats. Overall, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly closing out the game with its efficient threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with a combination of counterspells and removal while also presenting threats like Tarmogoyf and Sea-Dasher Octopus for a steady stream of damage. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Narset and Oko to control the board and generate card advantage. With the ability to tutor for specific cards and access powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a variety of matchups. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells of varying colors.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while presenting threats of its own. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Assassin's Trophy to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also deploying powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold to apply pressure. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and threats, this deck aims to control the game and come out on top through a combination of efficient plays and powerful spells.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with Dredge cards such as Bloodghast, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Stinkweed Imp in order to trigger effects like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to manipulate the deck, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of powerful creatures like Hollow One and Ichorid. Cabal Therapy and Force of Will provide disruption and protection while Creeping Chill helps to chip away at the opponent's life total.

The deck aims to assemble a game-winning combo by utilizing cards such as Doomsday, Thassa's Oracle, Demonic Consultation, and Demonic Tutor to manipulate the library and win the game on the spot. It includes a range of cantrips, counterspells, and tutors to help dig for combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption. By efficiently drawing cards, manipulating the library, and countering opposing spells, the deck can quickly and consistently execute its combo win condition in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach along with various card draw spells, counterspells, and tutors to quickly assemble a combo win condition. By casting spells from the graveyard and generating extra mana using Lion's Eye Diamond and Black Lotus, the deck can loop through its deck to either deck out the opponent with Brain Freeze or deal lethal damage with Sprite Dragon. The deck also uses various disruptive elements like Pyroblast and Flusterstorm to protect its combo and disrupt opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday to set up a game-winning combo using Thassa's Oracle and various draw spells to win the game instantly. It includes a variety of card selection and countermagic spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly while maintaining control of the game through disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn by resolving Doomsday and executing the combo with Thassa's Oracle.
